content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!--  <!DOCTYPE metadata SYSTEM "metadata.dtd">  --> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>Land Management Information Center, Minnesota Planning, and Minnesota Geological Survey</origin> <pubdate>1985</pubdate> <title>Hydrogeologic Map of Minnesota: Quaternary Hydrogeology, from MGS (Map S-3), 1979 (Digital Version)</title> <mgmg1cid></mgmg1cid> <pubinfo> <publish>Land Management Information Center, Minnesota Planning</publish> </pubinfo> <onlink>ftp://ftp.lmic.state.mn.us/pub/data/phys_biol/geology/hydqgeo.exe</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>These layers describe the geologic classification of the hydrogeologic, or water-bearing, units for the Quaternary (surficial, unconsolidated) deposits in Minnesota as delineated and classified by the Minnesota Geological Survey.  They represent an automated version of the Minnesota Geological Survey State Map Series Map S-3 (Hydrogeologic Map of Minnesota: Quaternary Hydrogeology), 1979, by Roman Kanivetsky  (1:500,000). The Quaternary Hydrogeology file was created by digitizing the  the 1:500,000-scale paper map. The 'Quaternary Hydrogeology - Materials' and 'Quaternary Hydrogeology - Yield' layers were then created based on attributes assigned to the file. The Arc coverages were also converted into  EPPL 40-acre grid cell files.</abstract> <purpose>To produce  general descriptive information on surficial hydrogeology for the state.</purpose> <supplinf>Minnesota, Statewide</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>1979</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>Map was delineated in 1979 based on the subsurface information available at the time.</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress></progress> <update>None planned</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-97.5</westbc> <eastbc>-89.0</eastbc> <northbc>49.5</northbc> <southbc>43.0</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt></themekt> <themekey>Geology, Hydrogeology, Surficial Hydrogeology, Quaternary Hydrogeology, Subsurface Hydrology, Water Resources, Ground Water</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekey>Minnesota, Statewide</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None</accconst> <useconst>Credit to the Minnesota Geological Survey for 'Hydrogeologic Map of Minnesota: Quaternary Hydrogeology', MGS Map S-3, 1979, by Roman Kanivetsky. Credit to LMIC for digital file.  Redistribution Conditions: In obtaining these data from LMIC, it is understood that you and/or your organization have the right to use them for any internal purpose. If you modify them, you should document those changes in a metadata record that should accompany all redistributed data.  If you transmit or provide these data in any form to another user, the data MUST be accompanied by a copy of this disclaimer and all documentation provided with the original data set including the full metadata record.</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Susanne Maeder</cntper> <cntorg>Land Management Information Center, Minnesota Planning</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GIS Data Coordinator</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> Mailing and Physical</addrtype> <address>300 Centennial Building; 658 Cedar Street</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55155</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651.201.2488</cntvoice> <cntfax>651.296.3698</cntfax> <cntemail>clearinghouse@mnplan.state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <browse> <browsen>ftp://ftp.lmic.state.mn.us/pub/data/phys_biol/geology/hydqgeo.gif</browsen> <browsed></browsed> </browse> <native>Arc/INFO 7.1.1</native> <crossref> <citeinfo> <title>Map:  'Hydrogeologic Map of Minnesota: QuaternaryHydrogeology', Minnesota Geological Survey Map S-3, 1979, by Roman Kanivetsky, is the basis for this data layer. Map is available from the Minnesota Geological Survey Bookstore  (612) 627-4782.  Other maps and associated data sets at statewide scale include Bedrock Geology, Bedrock Hydrogeology,  and Quaternary Geology.    In EPPL Grid format these data layers are also part of the LMIC MGC100 data set on CD. These include the main file for Quaternary Hydrogeology HYDQGEO.EPP, and derived files HYDQMAT.EPP, HYDQYIEL.EPP, and HYDQBOW.EPP.  File descriptions and legends for the EPPL files are otherwise as described in the Entity and Attribute section.</title> </citeinfo> </crossref> </idinfo> <dataqual> <attracc> <attraccr>Attribute coding has been verified.</attraccr> </attracc> <logic></logic> <complete>Complete, statewide.</complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar></horizpar> </horizpa> <vertacc> <vertaccr></vertaccr> </vertacc> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srcscale>500000</srcscale> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc>The Quaternary Hydrogeology Map was digitized by LMIC into an Arc/INFO polygon coverage (HYDQGEO)  from  the 1:500,000-scale paper map.  File was converted from the original Lambert Conformal projection of the base map to UTM, Zone 15 extended, NAD27.  Staff manually added attributes for materials and yield which were represented on the paper map. These attributes were then used with the Arc/Info 'DISSOLVE' command to create the Materials (HYDQMAT) and the Yield (HYDQYIEL) layers. The files were later converted from single precision, NAD27, shifted, to double precision, NAD83 unshifted, using the Arc 'PROJECT' command.  The EPPL files  (HYDQGEO.EPP, HYDQMAT.EPP, and HYDQYIEL.EPP) were created from the Arc Covers using the 'POLYGRID' command with a 40-acre cell size.  NOTE that there is also a 'Buried Outwash' file (HYDQBOW.EPP) on the EPPL data set. This attribute was originally digitized off the basemap and coded with an attribute. This file could be re-created from the EPPL file, if needed, or redigitized. The Buried Outwash file consists of 12-15 polygons spread across the state, with yield rating values (in gallons per minute) as an attribute.</procdesc> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <spdoinfo> <indspref></indspref> <direct>Vector</direct> <mgmg3obj>Point, Vector, Polygon</mgmg3obj> <mgmg3til>None. Statewide Coverage</mgmg3til> </spdoinfo> <spref> <horizsys> <geograph> <latres></latres> <longres></longres> </geograph> <planar> <mapproj> <mapprojn></mapprojn> <mgmg4par></mgmg4par> <otherprj></otherprj> </mapproj> <gridsys> <gridsysn>UTM</gridsysn> <utm> <utmzone>15E</utmzone> </utm> <spcs> <spcszone></spcszone> </spcs> <mgmg4coz></mgmg4coz> <mgmg4adj></mgmg4adj> </gridsys> <planci> <coordrep> <absres></absres> <ordres></ordres> </coordrep> <distbrep> <distres></distres> </distbrep> <plandu>Meters</plandu> </planci> </planar> <geodetic> <horizdn>NAD83</horizdn> <ellips>GRS80</ellips> </geodetic> </horizsys> <vertdef> <altsys> <altdatum></altdatum> <altunits></altunits> </altsys> <depthsys> <depthdn></depthdn> <depthdu></depthdu> </depthsys> </vertdef> </spref> <eainfo> <overview> <eaover>Three data layers are part of this Arc/Info data set:  HYDQGEO - Quaternary Hydrogeology - geology layer (main layer) HYDQMAT - Quaternary Hydrogeology - Materials HYDQYIEL - Wuaternary Hydrogeology - Yield  Attributes on HYDQGEO can be used to create the other two derived layers.</eaover> <eadetcit>The Quaternary Hydrogeology polygon coverage has the following data structure:   DATAFILE NAME: HYDQGEO.PAT                                              8 ITEMS: STARTING IN POSITION    1  COL  ITEM NAME         WDTH OPUT TYP N.DEC  ALTERNATE NAME     1  AREA                8   18  F    5     9  PERIMETER           8   18  F    5    17  HYDQGEO#            4    5  B    -    21  HYDQGEO-ID          4    5  B    -    25  HYDQ_CODE           3    3  I    -    28  HYDQMAT_KEY        80   80  C    -   108  HYDQYLD_KEY        80   80  C    -   188  HYDQGEO_KEY        80   80  C    -       **  REDEFINED ITEMS  **     25  HYDQMAT_CODE        1    1  C   -     26  HYDQYLD_CODE        1    1  C    -     27  HYDQGEO_CODE        1    1  C    -  HYDQ_CODE  is a 3-integer code, xyz, where:  x indicates the Aquifer Materials Code:  (HYDQMAT_CODE)  0 Non-aquifer 1 Gravel 2 Sand 3 Sand & Gravel 4 Sand, Silt, and Gravel 5 Stratified sand, silt, clay, & gravel 6 Sand (Lake Deposits)  y indicates the Yield Code:  (HYDQYLD_CODE)  Yield (Sustained rating of aquifer, in gallons per minute) 0 Less than 1 gallon per minute(Non-Aquifer) 2 1-5 gallons per minute 3 5-25 gallons per minute 4 25-100 gallons per minute 5 100-500 gallons per minute 6 more than 500 gallons per minute  z indicates the Hydrogeologic Classification: (HYDQGEO_CODE)  1 Outwash 2 Alluvium 3 Lake Deposits 4 Non-aquifer  The corresponding KEY fields in the data file contain the associated text. Essentially this file can be used to recreate the two files described below.  The Quaternary Hydrogeology - Materials polygon coverage contains the following attributes:   COL  ITEM NAME         WDTH OPUT TYP N.DEC  ALTERNATE NAME     1  AREA                8   18  F    5     9  PERIMETER           8   18  F    5    17  HYDQMAT#            4    5  B    -    21  HYDQMAT-ID          4    5  B    -    25  HYDQMAT_CODE        2    2  I    -    27  HYDQMAT_KEY        80   80  C    -   The Quaternary Hydrogeology - Yield polygon coverage contains the following data fields:   COL  ITEM NAME         WDTH OPUT TYP N.DEC  ALTERNATE NAME     1  AREA                8   18  F    5     9  PERIMETER           8   18  F    5    17  HYDYIEL#            4    5  B    -    21  HYDQYIEL-ID          4    5  B    -    25  HYDQYLD_CODE        2    2  I    -    27  HYDQYLD_KEY        80   80  C    -   Data attributes for these files are as already described above.  Note that, for the Materials and Yield coverages, the Non-Aquifer portions of the state are classified as '0' and therefore are part of the state's 'outer polygon' in arc/info. Thus there is no state boundary contained on these two files.</eadetcit> </overview> </eainfo> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Susanne Maeder</cntper> <cntorg>Land Management Information Center, Minnesota Planning</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GIS Data Coordinator</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> Mailing and Physical</addrtype> <address>300 Centennial Building; 658 Cedar Street</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55155</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651.201.2488</cntvoice> <cntfax>651.296.3698</cntfax> <cntemail>clearinghouse@mnplan.state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </distrib> <resdesc>hydqgeo</resdesc> <distliab>Limitations: Although extensive effort has been made to produce error free and complete data, all geographic information has limitations due to the scale, resolution, date and interpretation of the original source materials.  You should consult available data documentation (metadata) for these particular data to determine their limitations and the precision to which they depict distance, direction, location or other geographic characteristics.  These data may be subject to periodic change without prior notification.  No Warranty: These data are provided as is, without any warranty whatsoever, including but not limited to any warranty as to their performance, merchantability, or fitness for any particular purpose.  Liability: The entire risk as to the results of the use of these data is assumed by the user. LMIC is not responsible for any interpretation or conclusions based on these data made by those who acquire or use it. LMIC shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, special, incidental, compensatory or consequential damages or third party claims resulting from the use of these data, even if LMIC has been advised of the possibility of such potential loss or damage.  In States that do not allow the exclusion or limitation of incidental or consequential damages, you may not use these data.  Data Delivered on Electronic Media: If these data have been requested from LMIC on magnetic media, CD-ROM or any other physical media, LMIC will deliver this product in the computer-readable format agreed upon with the requestor.  LMIC will re-issue these data if they are determined unreadable by correctly adjusted computer input devices, or when the medium is delivered in a damaged condition.  Requests for re-issue of this digital data product must be made within 30 days of the date shipped from LMIC.</distliab> <stdorder> <digform> <digtinfo> <formname>Arc/INFO Export</formname> <formvern>7.1.1</formvern> <transize>1.1 MB Zipped file; 3 MB as arc export files</transize> </digtinfo> </digform> <ordering>This data set is distributed on the internet by clicking below after Online Linkage.  Doing so will tell your browser to start downloading a self-extracting 'ZIP' file which will contain the following:  - Arc Export files (.e00) of coverages HYDQGEO.E00, HYDQMAT.E00, and HYDQYIEL.E00. - Associated legend files HYDQGEO.LEG, HYDQMAT.LEG, and HYDQYIEL.LEG. - Metadata (.htm) file for the dataset - NOTICE.RTF, an important notice about this data set that can be read by most word processing software, and an ascii text version of the same notice (NOTICE.TXT)  After downloading this self-extracting 'zip' file (which will have an 'exe' extension), simply execute (run) the file.  (For example, you can double click it from Windows Explorer or File Manager).  Doing this will automatically extract the files described above.  You can then delete file types that you do not need, if any.  Note that the EPPL version of these files can be ordered on CD from LMIC as part of the MGC100 data set.</ordering> </stdorder> </distinfo> <metainfo> <metd>20060109</metd> <metc> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Susanne Maeder</cntper> <cntorg>Land Management Information Center, Minnesota Planning</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GIS Data Coordinator</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype> Mailing and Physical</addrtype> <address>300 Centennial Building; 658 Cedar Street</address> <city>St. Paul</city> <state>Minnesota</state> <postal>55155</postal> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>651.201.2488</cntvoice> <cntfax>651.296.3698</cntfax> <cntemail>susanne.maeder@mnplan.state.mn.us</cntemail> </cntinfo> </metc> <metstdn>Minnesota Geographic Metadata Guidelines</metstdn> <metstdv>1.2</metstdv> <metextns> <onlink>http://www.lmic.state.mn.us/gc/stds/metadata.htm</onlink> </metextns> </metainfo> </metadata>
